com.linecorp.armeria.server

Class DecoratingServiceCodec

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.linecorp.armeria.server.DecoratingServiceCodec
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServiceCodec

    public abstract class DecoratingServiceCodec
extends Object
implements ServiceCodec
    A ServiceCodec that decorates another ServiceCodec. Do not use this class unless you want to define a new dedicated ServiceCodec type by extending this class; prefer:
    • Service.decorate(Function)
    • Service.decorateCodec(Function)
    • Service.newDecorator(Function, Function)

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.linecorp.armeria.server.ServiceCodec

        public void codecAdded(ServiceConfig cfg)
                throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: ServiceCodec
        Invoked when the Service of this ServiceCodec has been added to a Server with the specified configuration. Please note that this method can be invoked more than once if the Service has been added more than once.

      • failureResponseFailsSession

        public boolean failureResponseFailsSession(ServiceInvocationContext ctx)
        Description copied from interface: ServiceCodec
        Returns true if and only if a failed invocation affects the status of its enclosing session protocol response. That is, if this property is false, the status of the enclosing session protocol response will indicate 'success' even if the invocation has failed.
        Specified by:
        failureResponseFailsSession in interface ServiceCodec

      • as

        public final <T extends ServiceCodec> Optional<T> as(Class<T> codecType)
        Description copied from interface: ServiceCodec
        Undecorates this ServiceCodec to find the ServiceCodec which is an instance of the specified codecType. Use this method instead of an explicit downcast since most ServiceCodecs are decorated via Service.decorate(Function) or Service.decorateCodec(Function) and thus cannot be downcast. For example: 
        
 Service s = new MyService().decorate(LoggingService::new).decorate(AuthService::new);
 MyServiceCodec c1 = s.codec().as(MyServiceCodec.class);
 LoggingServiceCodec c2 = s.codec().as(LoggingServiceCodec.class);
 AuthServiceCodec c3 = s.codec().as(AuthServiceCodec.class);
        Specified by:
        as in interface ServiceCodec
        Parameters:
        codecType - the type of the desired ServiceCodec
        Returns:
        the ServiceCodec which is an instance of codecType if this ServiceCodec decorated such a ServiceCodec. Optional.empty() otherwise.

      • toString

        public String toString()
